meanings.definition: To prevent or reduce the activation of the immune system.
meanings.sent1: After the transplant, the doctors needed to immunosuppress to protect the new organ.
meanings.sent2: Doctors may immunosuppress certain reactions to avoid harmful effects on the body.
meanings.sent3: The immune system decided to take a break, so it asked the doctors to immunosuppress for a while.
meanings.sent4: The medication acted like a shield, immunosuppressing any unwanted immune responses.
meanings.sent5: Immunosuppressing the immune system is like putting it on standby mode.

meanings.definition: A substance that inhibits the immune response.
meanings.sent1: The patient was prescribed an immunosuppress to manage their overactive immune system.
meanings.sent2: Immunosuppress can be crucial in treating autoimmune diseases.
meanings.sent3: The immunosuppress in the medicine made the immune system take a nap.
meanings.sent4: The immunosuppress acted like a gatekeeper, controlling the immune system's reactions.
meanings.sent5: The doctor recommended a specific immunosuppress to regulate the immune response.

meanings.definition: The act of suppressing the immune system.
meanings.sent1: Immunosuppress is necessary after certain medical procedures to avoid rejection.
meanings.sent2: The immunosuppress of the immune system can have both positive and negative effects.
meanings.sent3: The immunosuppress of the immune system felt like hitting the snooze button on an alarm.
meanings.sent4: The immunosuppress during treatment was like putting a temporary halt on the immune system.
meanings.sent5: The gradual immunosuppress allowed the body to adjust to the changes.
